definition: to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: A special meeting was to be held that day in Bengma Motor Company in Ottawa, Canada.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大渥太华的奔马公汽公司这天举行一次特别会议。

sentences.english: The galloping horses he paints are extremely lifelike .
sentences.chinese: 他画的奔马，栩栩如生，极其神似。

sentences.english: The actors reproduced the running horses by pounding pillows.
sentences.chinese: 演员们捶打枕头模拟奔马的声音。

sentences.english: The bronze galloping horse unearthed in Wuwei City is the symbol of Chinese tourism industry.
sentences.chinese: 武威出土的铜奔马被作为中国的旅游标志。

sentences.english: This "Galloping Horse" was also painted by him. Wasn't it?
sentences.chinese: 这张“奔马图”也是展子虔画的吗？

sentences.english: The galloping horses he painted are extremely lifelike.
A picture with six horses graph called "BenMaTu".
sentences.chinese: 一幅画着六匹马的图叫《奔马图》。

definition: proceeding at a tremendous pace/getting on like a house on fire
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
